item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Get Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin (Can It Be Shiny)
item.description:
Pokemon GO debuts Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin during the Pokemon Horizons Celebration event. There are several ways to get the new Costumed Pokemon during featured events. Those who get a Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin can later evolve it into a Costumed Meowscarada.

Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin is available in Pokemon GO starting from Wednesday, April 16, 2025. Floragato is a pure Grass-type Pokemon that evolves from Sprigatito and can later evolve into a powerful Meowscarada. Many trainers are also looking to get their hands on a Shiny Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin. This guide details the best way to get Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin and explores its Shiny availability.

Pokemon GO Wild Spawn: Get Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin

Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) is a Pokemon GO wild spawn; you can encounter it while roaming in the wild. While the chances of a Costumed Floragato encounter are random, events featuring the monster increase its wild spawn rate. You can also use several in-game items to further increase wild Pokemon spawn rate and increase the likeliness of a wild Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) encounter.

  • Floragato’s Weather Boost activates in places with sunny weather .
  • Find a PokeStop located in a sunny area .
  • Attach a Lure Module to that specific PokeStop.
  • Activate an Incense .
  • The final step is to traverse around the PokeStop .

This strategy doesn’t guarantee a Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) encounter; other Pokemon with the same Weather Boost might also appear instead.

Pokemon GO Raid Encounter: Get Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin

Pokemon GO Costumed Floragato comes as a 3-Star Raid Boss during featured events. Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin Raid winners get a guaranteed Floragato Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin encounter. But winning requires powerful counters with moves that fall under Floragato’s weaknesses.

Floragato Pokemon GO Weaknesses And Resistances

Weaknesses

Resistances

Bug-type Moves

Electric-type Moves

Fire-type Moves

Grass-type Moves

Flying-type Moves

Ground-type Moves

Ice-type Moves

Water-type Moves

Poison-type Moves

Best Floragato Raid Counters In Pokemon GO

  • White Kyurem - Ice Fang (Ice) & Ice Burn (Ice)
  • Rayquaza - Air Slash (Flying) & Dragon Ascent (Flying)
  • Black Kyurem - Dragon Tail (Dragon) & Freeze Shock (Ice)
  • Reshiram - Fire Fang (Fire) & Overheat (Fire)
  • Volcarona - Fire Spin (Fire) & Overheat (Fire)
  • Salamence - Fire Fang (Fire) & Fly (Flying)
  • Ho-Oh - Incinerate (Fire) & Brave Bird (Flying)
  • Heatran - Fire Spin (Fire) & Fire Blast (Fire)
  • Moltres - Fire Spin (Fire) & Overheat (Fire)
  • Blacephalon - Incinerate (Fire) & Mystical Fire (Fire)

Can Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) Be Shiny In Pokemon GO?

Yes, you can encounter a Shiny Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) in Pokemon GO . Both Regular and Shiny variants of this Costumed Pokemon debuted during the Pokemon Horizons Series Celebration event.

Pokemon GO: How To Get Shiny Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin)

You can get a Shiny Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) the same way as a Regular variant. There is no surefire way that guarantees a Shiny Pokemon encounter; you have to match the monster’s Shiny odds. Encounter multiple Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) using the above-mentioned methods. Lucky players might get a Shiny Floragato (Wearing A Hat With Liko’s Pin) in Pokemon GO .

item.title: Devil May Cry 5: All Trophies & Achievements Guide
item.description:
Devil May Cry 5 is the pinnacle of the modern hack-and-slash action-adventure genre, featuring complex combat mechanics and replayability. In addition to the game throwing tons of demons in your way to decimate with stylish swordplay, it also allows players to unlock various trophies and achievements. Let's check out all the trophies that are available in DMC 5 and see how to unlock them all to get that Platinum.

All Trophies & Achievements in DMC 5

Devil May Cry 5 features a whopping list of 49 trophies , with some a lot tougher to unlock than others. Players may have to replay the game multiple times to finally unlock the Platinum trophy.

Here's the list of all the trophies and achievements you can unlock in DMC 5 .

Trophy

How to Unlock

Devil May Cry

You'll need to unlock all the trophies.

Let's Rock

Complete Devil May Cry 5 on Human difficulty mode.

Showtime!

Complete Devil May Cry 5 on Devil Hunter difficulty mode.

Doing Daddy Proud

Complete Devil May Cry 5 on Son of Sparda difficulty mode.

Dance with the Devil

Complete Devil May Cry 5 on Dante Must Die difficulty mode.

Stairway to Heaven

Complete Devil May Cry 5 on Heaven or Hell difficulty mode.

Highway to Hell

Complete Devil May Cry 5 on Hell and Hell difficulty mode.

Fall from Grace

Complete the prologue by either defeating or losing to Urizen.

Protect the People

Defeat all the enemies in Mission 1. Failing to quickly defeat Red Empusa will keep this trophy locked.

Where the Red Orbs Grow

Break the red orbs crystal inside a building next to the crashed ambulance in Mission 2.

Reunion

Complete mission 3 to unlock this trophy.

Backroad

Destroy a wall with a painted red skull and a female figure by summoning Nightmare. The wall can be found right after the railway bridge section.

Break a Leg

Deplete the HP of any one of the giant robotic legs in Mission 5 to unlock this trophy.

End of the Line

Complete mission 6 to unlock this trophy.

Share the Pain

Complete mission 7 with both Nero and V.

Light in the Darkness

Complete mission 8 to unlock this trophy.

Eagle-Eyed

Destroy the wall with a torn poster of a skull in mission 9 by summoning Nightmare.

This Ain't Over

Complete mission 10 to unlock this trophy.

Don't Mess with the Best

Parry Cavaliere Angelo's attack by using Dante's Swordmaster style towards the end of mission 11.

The Qilphoth

Complete mission 12 to unlock this trophy.

Each in His Own Way

Complete mission 13 with Nero, Dante, and V to unlock this trophy.

Gotta Hurry

Complete mission 14 to unlock this trophy.

Slick Moves

Avoid taking damage from spike traps as Nero in mission 15.

Obedience Training

Disrupt the Cerberus element switch by stunning it in Mission 16.

Back to Life

Complete mission 17 to unlock this trophy.

Man on a Mission

Complete mission 18 to unlock this trophy.

Battle for the Ages

Complete missions 19 and 20 without losing to Vergil to unlock this trophy.

Not too Shabby

Perform a stylish S-rank combo.

Steppin' Up the Style

Perform a stylish SS-rank combo.

Seriously Stylish Slaying!

Perform a stylish SSS-rank combo.

Secrets Exposed

Clear all 12 Secret Missions.

The Quick and the Dead

Defeat 5 enemies within a second to unlock this trophy.

Well I'll Be Damned

Defeat Urizen in either the Prologue or mission 8 to unlock this trophy.

Hell of a Hunter

Clear all 21 missions with an S-Rank on any difficulty.

Worthy of Legend

Clear all 21 missions with an S-Rank on all difficulties except Heaven or Hell.

I Believe I Can Fly

Focus on performing air combos to accumulate at least 60 minutes of air time across all characters and missions to unlock this trophy.

Nothing's Impossible

Unlock all Nero's skills.

Be the Legend

Unlock all Dante's skills.

Demon Breeder

Unlock all V's skills.

Physical Perfection

Find all 32 blue orb fragments and purchase all 6 blue orbs in Nico's Van to max out your vitality gauge and unlock this trophy.

The Devil's Own

Find all 8 purple orb fragments and purchase all 5 purple orbs in Nico's Van to max out your Devil Trigger gauge and unlock this trophy.

A New Job

Kill more enemies than Vergil during the ending credits, and don't skip the cutscene to unlock this trophy.

Jackpot!

Collect more than 1,000,000 red orbs to unlock this trophy.

Demon Destroyer

Defeat 1000 enemies in total to unlock this trophy.

Rearm and Repeat

Collect more than 100 Devil Breakers as Nero before completing the game to unlock this trophy.

Dante the Gambler

Use more than 500,000 red orbs with Dr. Faust weapon to unlock this trophy.

Who Needs Weapons Anyway?

Complete mission 11 without equipping a weapon set for Dante on any difficulty. The best way to do this is by using the Royal Guard Stance to fill up the Devil Trigger gauge and attack with it.

Unarmed and Dangerous

Unequip all Devil Breakers before starting and completing mission 7 to unlock this trophy.

Pet Protection

Complete mission 5 without letting Shadow and Griffon die.

item.title: Marathon Director Comments on Competing With Other Extraction Shooters
item.description: During a recent gameplay reveal of Marathon, Joe Ziegler commented on what makes Marathon different from other extraction shooters. Marathon is set to release in September of 2025. Additionally, there will be a closed alpha available to the U.S. and Canada which will open on April 23rd.

item.title: New Turn-Based Single-Player Star Wars Game Announced
item.description:
Summary

  • Star Wars Zero Company is a turn-based strategy game by Respawn and Bit Reactor, featuring a diverse array of main characters.
  • The official title, characters, and artwork for Star Wars Zero Company have been revealed by EA, generating excitement among fans.
  • More details about the game will be unveiled at the Star Wars Celebration event in Japan on April 19, with leaks hinting at Mandalorian involvement.

Respawn and Bit Reactor have officially revealed Star Wars Zero Company , the turn-based Star Wars strategy title that was first announced back in 2022. This was one of three EA-published Star Wars video games unveiled at that time, with the first being 2023’s Star Wars Jedi: Survivor . The third project was a Mandalorian-centric first-person shooter that has since been canceled.

There are plenty of avenues for a Star Wars -themed real-time strategy game to explore, and fans have been speculating on what Respawn and Bit Reactor’s project could be about. For those who aren’t familiar with Bit Reactor, it was formed in 2022 by former Firaxis Games members who worked on hit strategy games like Civilization and XCOM . This pedigree being combined with Respawn’s success with the two Star Wars Jedi games has much potential, and now gamers have an official title for the pair’s new Star Wars title.

As shown on the official EA website, Respawn and Bit Reactor’s turn-based Star Wars game is called Star Wars Zero Company . The name had been rumored ahead of this announcement, but now it is official. Along with the name itself, EA has released promotional artwork featuring Star Wars Zero Company ’s main characters, which seem to include a lightsaber-wielding Tognath Jedi, a former Clone Trooper, a Mandalorian, a red-and-silver R5 astromech droid, a person wearing some sort of hazmat suit, and another mysterious figure holding a hologram of a BD-1 Battle Droid.

Star Wars Zero Company Confirmed

More information about Star Wars Zero Company will be revealed at the Star Wars Celebration event in Japan on April 19, as reported by Gemastu. Developer Bit Reactor will hold a full panel from 16:30 to 17:30 Japanese Standard Time (3:30 AM to 4:30 AM Eastern Time, 12:30 AM to 1:30 AM Pacific). Gaming journalist Lucy James will host the presentation alongside members of Bit Reactor, Respawn Entertainment, and Lucasfilm Games.

Previous Star Wars Zero Company leaks suggested that Mandalorians would be involved and that part of the game would be set in a mining colony in the Ring of Kafrene from Rogue One: A Star Wars Story . It was also said that gameplay would be similar to the XCOM games, with an isometric view and a hub world that has options for players to upgrade and customize their forces. Fans won’t have to wait too much longer to see if these rumors are true, as Star Wars Celebration is being held in Japan this weekend.

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

The story of Cal Kestis continues in Star Wars Jedi: Survivor™, a third person galaxy-spanning action-adventure game from Respawn Entertainment, developed in collaboration with Lucasfilm Games. This narratively-driven, single player title picks up five years after the events of Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order™ and follows Cal’s increasingly desperate fight as the galaxy descends further into darkness. Pushed to the edges of the galaxy by the Empire, Cal will find himself surrounded by threats new and familiar. As one of the last surviving Jedi Knights, Cal is driven to make a stand during the galaxy’s darkest times - but how far is he willing to go to protect himself, his crew, and the legacy of the Jedi Order?

Explore an Untamed Galaxy – Discover new planets and familiar frontiers in the Star Wars galaxy, each with unique biomes, challenges, and enemies. Master new skills, equipment, and abilities that will augment the ways you explore, fight, and roam. With larger areas to explore and more to discover off the beaten path, players who adventure beyond the horizon will find hidden rewards.

Powered by

item.title: Overwatch 2 Shows Off Stadium Gameplay
item.description:
Summary

  • The Stadium game mode in Overwatch 2 will include a third-person camera option, upgraded abilities, and game-breaking character builds.
  • A new trailer highlights what players can expect when the mode is released on April 22.
  • 15 heroes appear in the trailer, with more to be added in future updates.

Overwatch 2 just revealed a new gameplay trailer for Stadium, the highly customizable game mode coming in Season 16. Featuring a third-person camera option, upgradable abilities, and game-breaking character builds, Stadium arrives in Overwatch 2 with its first batch of heroes and maps on April 22.

Stadium is a new type of game mode that Blizzard first revealed during the Overwatch 2 Spotlight event in February. Two teams battle in this best-of-seven grudge match, collecting currency throughout the game to upgrade their heroes with incredible abilities between each round.

Now, just a week ahead of the game mode’s official release, Overwatch 2 has revealed an exciting gameplay trailer showcasing the Stadium game mode. Featuring a gripping comeback from the perspective of one of the two teams, fans can see some of the powerful new abilities at play, including an AoE Nano-Boost from Ana, a Biotic Orb Multiball from Moira, a damaging Orbital Ray from Juno, a mini B.O.B. with Ashe, and a rolling snowball attack for Mei. Players can also see how Cash, the currency used to upgrade their abilities, is earned via eliminations and other gameplay, or by selling powers and items between each round.

Overwatch 2 Stadium Game Mode Arrives April 22

Only 15 heroes can be seen in the Stadium trailer, though Blizzard eventually plans on adding others in the future. Soldier: 76, Genji, Reaper, Ashe, Mei, and Cassidy are the options for damage heroes, Juno, Ana, Moira, Kiriko, and Lucio as options for support players, and Reinhardt, Zarya, Junker Queen, and Orisa make up the cast of playable tanks. Additionally, though she is not in the trailer, D.Va can be seen in other promotional material for Stadium in Overwatch 2 , so she may be available as well. Shortened versions of familiar Clash, Push, and Control maps appear in the game mode, alongside brand-new maps like Gladius, a battlefield located inside the Colosseo arena.

The Stadium game mode debuts with the launch of Season 16 on April 22. Overwatch 2 has previously stated that it hopes Stadium will become a new pillar of the game alongside the likes of classic Quick Play and Competitive modes, so players should expect it to receive plenty of post-launch support in the coming months.

Overwatch 2 Heroes Available in Stadium

Tank

Damage

Support

D.Va (presumed)

Ashe

Ana

Junker Queen

Cassidy

Juno

Orisa

Genji

Kiriko

Reinhardt

Mei

Lucio

Zarya

Soldier: 76

Moira

Even beyond Stadium, Season 16 is gearing up to be a major update for Overwatch 2 . Freja, a highly-mobile bounty hunter, joins the cast of playable damage heroes, several over- and under-powered Perks are being tweaked and replaced, and 6v6 Open Queue will continue to be available in Overwatch 2 in both Quick Play and Competitive. Regardless of how they play the game, it seems like fans will have a lot to look forward to in Season 16.
